title: module refresh will not generate lmod files despite config
body:
`module refresh` only generates tcl modules despite the following being in my `~/.spack/modules.yaml`:

```yaml
enable::
    -lmod
```
(Full config pasted further down)

I was able to temporarily work around this issue by running `spack module refresh --module-type lmod --delete-tree` but based on the [modules tutorial](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial_modules.html?highlight=lmod#core-compiler-mpi), this does not seem like it should be necessary.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
# Clean clone of spack
# Edit ~/.spack/modules.yaml (see exact config further down)
$ spack install lmod emacs tmux # these are the packages that I happened to install first. I believe only lmod is necessary
$ spack module refresh
```

### Information on your system

This includes:

 1. which platform you are using

`Red Hat 7.5 (LLNL-managed desktop)`

 2. any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.)

My modules.yaml:
```yaml
modules:
  enable::
    - lmod
  lmod:
    core_compilers:
      - 'gcc@4.8.5'
    hierarchy:
      - mpi
```
